ASMODEE DIGITAL PRIVACY POLICY
Version : August 29th, 2016
Asmodee Digital ("Asmodee Digital", "we" or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. We have prepared this Privacy Policy to describe to you our practices regarding the collection, use and disclosure of personal information of users of our mobile applications (each an "Application") (collectively, the "Site"), and online services ("Services"). This Privacy Policy is attached to the Terms of Use of Asmodee Digital, and serves as an integral part thereof. The Site and the servers that make the Site available are located in France. Your personal information may be collected and processed in France and may be transferred to other countries in accordance to the terms and conditions of the terms of the Directive 95/46/EC relative to the Protection of the Personal Data. The Person in charge of collecting data in accordance with this Privacy Policy is Asmodee Digital, a French Société par actions simplifiée whose Headquarters office is located 18 rue Jacqueline Auriol – 78280 Guyancourt, registered with Versailles’ Registry under number 818 058 216,

Collection of Personal Information
There are two types of information we may collect through your use of the Websites/Apps:
1. “Personal Information,” which is the type of information that specifically identifies you personally and/or can be used alone to contact you online or offline, such as your full name, physical address, email address, telephone number, photograph, precise geolocation information (i.e., your specific location), credit card information and, in some cases, usernames; and
2. “Non-Personal Information,” which is information that does not identify you and cannot be used to contact you personally, including information about you such as your date of birth, age, ZIP code, non-precise geolocation information (e.g., your city), and gender, as well as information about your computer and mobile device, such as your unique device ID, or other persistent identifiers, and their hardware/software/firmware. Non-Personal Information also includes “Usage Data,” which is anonymous data tied to your computer and/or device, such as the actions you take within and outside of the Websites/Apps, the browser you use, the identity of other apps included on your device, the date and time of your use of the Websites/Apps, your game progress, play time, score and achievements, and the URLs you visited and/or apps you used before and after using our Websites/Apps.
-We collect Personal Information from you in a variety of ways when you use the Site and Services:
-We may collect Personal Information from you, such as your e-mail, zip code, country, birthdate, login name, and password when you create an account to log in to our network ("Account").
-If you use our Services on your mobile device, including through our Application(s), we may collect your phone number and the unique device id number.
-When connecting to our Services via a service provider that uniquely identifies your mobile device, we may receive this identification and use it to offer extended services and/or functionality.
-When you order products or services on our Site or through our Services, we will collect all information necessary to complete the transaction, including your name, credit card information, billing information and shipping information. This information may be shared with third parties who help process and fulfill your purchases. When you submit credit card numbers, we encrypt that information using industry standard technology.
-We retain information on your behalf, such as files and messages that you store using your Account.
-If you provide us feedback or contact us via e-mail (in particular but not limited to request support), we will collect your name and e-mail address, as well as any other content included in the e-mail, in order to send you a reply.
-When you post content on our Site or through our Services, the information contained in your posting will be stored in our servers and other users will be able to see it, along with your login name. This information will be visible to others, including anonymous visitors to the Site.
-Some services provide you with tools and content so you can create / share original content. These user-generated content may be collected by Asmodee Digital and should be considered as Personal Information as long as you will integrate your own personal data or those of another person (eg your name or picture ).
-If you choose to send a message to another user or defined group of users through our message, chat, post or other in-game function, we may collect any Personal Information you may disclose through such means, as well as the necessary Personal Information of the user(s) you are contacting, in order to facilitate the communication (Note: we will never collect any information sent outside of the functionality of our Site, including through emails or text messages).
-When you participate and interact with other users through a chat room or forum, we may collect the content of your voice and text communications, the time and location of your activities and your ID in online and your IP address.
-If you choose to enable push notifications, we may use your Personal Information, or Non-Personal Information such as a device ID, in order to send push notifications to your device.
-When you participate in one of our surveys, we may collect additional profile information.
-We also collect other types of Personal Information that you provide to us voluntarily, such as your operating system and version, product registration number, and other requested information if you contact us via e-mail regarding support for the Services.
-If you participate in a sweepstakes, contest or giveaway on our Site, we may ask you for your e-mail address and/or home number (to notify you if you win or not). We may also ask for first and last names, and sometimes post office addresses to verify your identity. In some situations we may need additional information as a part of the entry process, such as a prize selection choice. These sweepstakes and contests are voluntary. We recommend that you read the rules for each sweepstakes and contest that you enter.
-We may also collect Personal Information at other points in our Site or through our Services that state that Personal Information is being collected; in such situations, we will use such Personal Information for the sole purposes for which you submitted it.
-We may collect precise geolocation information provided that, prior to doing so initially, you will either be informed of this practice or be prompted to allow or block this feature. In the event you proceed with acquiring the Site or choose to allow this feature, you will be able to block it at any time thereafter by taking the appropriate steps in the Settings tab.
We will not collect any Personal Information from you simply by virtue of your utilization of our Site/Services; we only collect it if you choose to submit it to us. We do, however, collect Non-Personal Information such as device IDs, IP addresses and other persistent identifiers, as well as Usage Data, whenever you use our Site. Such Non-Personal Information is not combined with Personal Information unless you choose to submit Personal Information to us.
Information You Provide to Third Party Sites. The Services allow users to login to the Services via Facebook and other third party sites ("Third Party Sites") and to access such Third Party Sites to interact with friends and to share information on such Third Party Sites. If you login to the Services via a Third Party Site or otherwise connect your Third Party Site account to your Account, i) you are allowing the Services to access, store and use pursuant to the terms of this Privacy Policy your information that you shared with the Third Party Sites, and ii) you are agreeing to the Third Party Site's Terms of Use/Terms of Service in your use of the Services. In addition, we may receive information from such Third Party Site to make it easier for you to create an Account on the Site/Services and show our relevant content from your Third Party Site account. Once you register on the Site/Services and connect with a Third Party Site you will be able to automatically post recent activity back to the Third Party Site. Any information that we collect from your Third Party Site account may depend on the Third Party Site's privacy settings, so please consult the Third Party Site's privacy and data practices. You have the option to disable the connection to your Third Party Site account at any time by contacting us at https://asmodee.helpshift.com.

Our Use of Collected Personal Information
We use the Personal Information we collect for the purposes indicated at the time you provide such information. In general, Personal Information you submit to us is used either (but not limited) to :
- Provide you with any goods, services and functionality you ordered,
- respond to any requests that you make,
- send you newsletters, promotions or marketing materials,
- contact you in relation to contest registration and prize acceptance,
- facilitate the creation of and secure your Account on our network;
- identify you as a user in our system;
- provide improved administration of our Site and Services;
- improve the quality of experience when you interact with our Site and Services;
- send you administrative e-mail notifications, such as security, or support and maintenance advisories; and respond to your inquiries or other requests.
- aid us in servicing you better.
For instance, if you register in a contest, we will use the registration information to notify contest winners, or if you purchase a product, we will use the billing information you provide to fulfill the order. We may also e-mail you to provide information on upcoming Asmodee Digital products, updates and promotions, and occasionally, and only with consent at the time you create an Account, we might also e-mail you to provide information on upcoming partners’/third parties’ products, updates and promotions. We will provide you with the opportunity to opt out of receiving such material in the future at any time. Our mailings and e-mails will also include information allowing you to ask not to receive such information in the future. We may receive testimonials and comments from users who have had positive experiences with our Site/Services. We occasionally publish such content. When we publish this content, we may identify our users by their first and last name and may also indicate their home city. We obtain the user's consent prior to posting his or her name along with the testimonial. We may post user feedback on the Site/Services from time to time. We will share your feedback with your first name and last initial only. If we choose to post your first and last name along with your feedback, we will obtain your consent prior to posting you name with your feedback. If you make any comments on a blog or forum associated with our Site/Services, you should be aware that any Personal Information you submit there can be read, collected, or used by other users of these forums, and could be used to send you unsolicited messages. We are not responsible for the personally identifiable information you choose to submit in these blogs and forums. In cases of obvious abuse from users of the Site/Services, Asmodee Digital reserves the right to block certain user accounts or certain IP addresses. The IP addresses may be used to identify you in order to enforce the Terms of Use. Asmodee Digital use your birth date or your age to filter access to its forums and instant messengers based on the official classification. Asmodee Digital can not monitor all chat areas and do not take any commitment in this direction. However, Asmodee Digital reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to remove any content related to your communications without notice. All data collected in this way can be used by Asmodee Digital to enforce its Terms of Use, to respect the law and to protect its rights, its subsidiaries and other users, as well as for the safety of employees and users. This information may be disclosed to any competent administrative or judicial authority. Personal Information under French Law shall not be disclosed to a third party by Asmodee Digital unless you express prior approval.

Our Use of collected Non-Personal Information
We may create anonymous data records from Personal Information by excluding information (such as your name) that makes the data personally identifiable to you. We use this anonymous data or Non-Personal Information for administrative, analytical, research, optimization, security and other purposes. Specifically, we may use your Non-Personal Information and anonymous date to:
- analyze request and usage patterns so that we may enhance the content of our Services and improve Site navigation,
- compile statistics,
- respond to customer service inquiries;
- protect against cheating, crime or fraud, or for other security reasons.
We reserve the right to use anonymous data/Non-Personal Information for any purpose and disclose anonymous data /Non-Personal Information to third parties in our sole discretion. Information Collected via Technology. To make our Site and Services more useful to you, our servers collect information from you, including your browser type, operating system, Internet Protocol ("IP") address (which is the number assigned to your computer when you surf the Web), domain name, and/or a date/time stamp for your visit. We also gather certain information automatically and store it in log files. This information includes IP addresses, browser type, Internet service provider ("ISP"), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and clickstream data. In addition, we use cookies to collect information (please refer to section “Cookies” below) We may use both session cookies (which expire once you close your web browser) and persistent cookies (which stay on your computer until you delete them). Cookies help us give you faster access to pages you have already visited, allow you to personalize your pages, and help you to participate in some online activities on our Site. Your IP address and cookies are not connected to any Personal Information. We may also collect Non-Personal information from your mobile device if you have downloaded our Application(s). Examples of information that may be collected and used include how you use the Application(s) and information about the type of device you use. In addition, in the event our Application(s) crashes on your mobile device, we will receive information about your mobile device model software version and device carrier, which allows us to identify and fix bugs and otherwise improve the performance of our Application(s). We use Google Analytics to help analyze how users use the Site. Google Analytics uses Cookies to collect information such as how often users visit the Site, what pages they visit, and what other sites they used prior to coming to the Site. We use the information we get from Google Analytics only to improve our Site and Services. Google's ability to use and share information collected by Google Analytics about your visits to the Site is restricted by the Google Analytics Terms of Use and the Google Privacy Policy. How We Respond to Do Not Track Signals. We do not currently respond to "do not track" signals or other mechanisms that might enable consumers to opt out of tracking on our Site.

Advertising Messages
Asmodee Digital uses third-party technology for broadcasting advertising messages online which may collect information while broadcasting advertisement messages on the Service and which may temporarily display ads within the Service. The information that is collected and used for the targeted ad may, among other things, consist of: the number of views an ad gets, the mobile device’s unique identifier or other identifiers and device settings, information on your use of the Service, the compatible mobile Terminal, the ad(s) being broadcast, the placement and the duration of the ad(s) in game, and your response to the ad(s) (where applicable). The analysis tools and the technology for broadcasting advertising messages online may use server log files, web beacons, cookies, tracking pixels, and other technology used to collect said information, and may combine the information collected on other Asmodee Digital products and services with information collected on other websites and third party products and mobile services, as well as with demographic studies, advertisement investigations, market studies, and other analytical investigations. This information alone does not constitute personal data. However, if Asmodee Digital combines it with personal data, Asmodee Digital will treat it as personal data in accordance with its Privacy Policy

Cookies
In connection with the foregoing collection of Personal Information and Non-Personal Information, we may also use cookies or similar technologies (tiny files that are stored on your computer's hard drive or mobile device when you visit certain web pages or apps that do not contain your name, email address or other Personal Information but that identify your computer or mobile device and may store information about you such as behavioral data). Should you choose to submit Personal Information to us, we may link cookie information to such Personal Information. If you decide at any time that you no longer wish to accept cookies from our Service for any of the purposes described above, then you can instruct your browser, by changing its settings, to stop accepting cookies or to prompt you before accepting a cookie from the websites you visit. Consult your browser's technical information. If you do not accept cookies, however, you may not be able to use all portions of the Service or all functionality of the Service (in particular you may lose access to the services you purchased). To learn more about cookies and how to reject them, visit www.allaboutcookies.org. In addition, certain third-party advertisers may also make use of cookies in their ads served within our Site/Services. Such cookies will collect anonymous behavioral data which those advertisers may use to serve you targeted ads both within and outside of our Site/Services. You can opt out of that practice by certain participating companies by visiting www.aboutads.info/choices and following the steps described therein. If you decide at any time that you no longer wish to have your Facebook account linked to your Account, then you may de-link the connection by contacting us as https://asmodee.helpshift.com. You may also manage the sharing of certain Personal Information with us when you connect with us through Facebook. Please refer to the privacy settings of Facebook to determine how you may adjust our permissions and manage the interactivity between the Services and your social media account or mobile device.

The Sharing of Personal Information
Asmodee Digital will never share, sell, rent or otherwise provide/transfer your Personal Information to any outside companies or other party without your explicit consent except as described below. With your prior consent, Asmodee Digital may provide your information to outside companies that offer products or services that may be of interest. We may share your Personal Information with third party service providers to:
- provide you with the Services that we offer you through our Site/Services;
- conduct quality assurance testing;
- facilitate creation of accounts;
- provide technical support;
- and/or provide other services to us.
If we do so, we require those other companies to sign confidentiality agreements, to be bound by this Privaly Policy, and these companies will be authorized to use your Personal Information only for the purposes for which they are engaged. For instance,
- We may share non-precise geolocation information or precise geolocation information (if you choose to allow us to collect it) with advertisers to allow them to display more relevant and geographically appropriate advertisements to you.
- We may share your Usage Data and Non-Personal Information, such as device IDs, advertising IDs or other persistent identifiers and non-precise geolocation information with our advertising partners. Those partners may use your Non-Personal Information to serve you tailored advertisements outside of our Site/Services: please note that this sharing is limited to anonymous, aggregated Non-Personal Information only and we will not share your Personal Information with advertisers without your prior consent.
- When you make purchases on the Site/Services, Asmodee Digital may share with external service providers your name, postal address, email address, country and your payment details, ( number of your card, the name of cardholder, expiry date and security code) in order to allow the proper functioning of services of processing payments by credit card and delivery of products, delivery or prices of products offered as part of promotions. We keep details of your payments, as well as details of purchases you make. Details of transactions is kept either at Asmodee Digital’s office or at the office of our external service provider, if we use an external provider. This store is done for internal purposes as well as for internal auditing, accounting, compliance and legal purposes.You may be asked to provide the name of your telecom operator, the model of your mobile phone and a valid mobile number in order to provide purchase instructions directly through your mobile phone.
We may share some or all of your Personal Information with our parent company, subsidiaries, joint ventures, or other companies under a common control ("Affiliates"), in which case we will require our Affiliates to honor this Privacy Policy. We may share some or all of your Personal Information in connection with or during negotiation of any merger, financing, acquisition or dissolution, transaction or proceeding involving sale, transfer, divestiture, or disclosure of all or a portion of our business or assets. In the event of an insolvency, bankruptcy, or receivership, Personal Information may also be transferred as a business asset. If another company acquires our company, business, or assets, that company will possess the Personal Information collected by us and will assume the rights and obligations regarding your Personal Information as described in this Privacy Policy. Some of our Applications and Services may enable you to post content to Third Party Sites. Our Site/Services also offer social sharing features such as “Share” or “Like” on Third Party Sites. If you decide to use such features, it may allow the sharing and collection of Personal Information and Non-Personal Information both to and from such Third Party Sites. You acknowledge and agree that you are solely responsible for your use of the Third Party Site and that it is your responsibility to review the terms of use and privacy policy of the Third Party Site. We will not be responsible or liable for: (i) the availability or accuracy of the Third Party Site; (ii) the content, products or services on or availability of the Third Party Site; or (iii) your use of the Third Party Site. The Site/Services may allow you to create a public profile that may allow you to disclose and share publicly some of your Personal Information such as photos, posts, friends, and other contents. Unless otherwise provided on the Site /Services, these Personal Information that you provide to us when you register or update your profile are displayed on your public profile and those you post to the Site are also meant for public consumption. We may display this content on the Site, and further distribute it to a wider audience through third party sites and services. Once displayed on publicly viewable web pages, that information can be collected and used by others. We cannot control who reads your posting or what other users may do with the information that you voluntarily post, so it is very important that you do not put Personal Information in your posts. Once you have posted information publicly, while you will still be able to edit and delete it on the Site, you will not be able to edit or delete such information cached, collected, and stored elsewhere by others (e.g., search engines). You can change the privacy setting at any time If Asmodee Digital believes disclosure of Personal Information is necessary to defend the rights or property of us or our Site and Services or anyone else, we may disclose the relevant Personal Information. We may also disclose personal information if we believe that the disclosure is required by law, or in response to a legal request in particular but not limited if the information relates to actual or threatened harmful conduct, to investigate and/or take action against illegal activity, suspected abuse or unauthorized use of the Site/Services, or to protect the property or safety of others. We will never share, sell, rent or otherwise provide a minor Personal Information to any outside company for commercial prospection or solicitation purposes without the minor legal representative’s express consent.

Unsubscribing from Announcements - Opt-out Policy
From time to time, we send announcements by e-mail: news about coming games, important changes in our Site or Services, special offers, etc. Like you, we despise "spam," so we are very reasonable in the number of messages we send. We also try to only send messages that are relevant to your Account. For example, we send pre-order offers of Terraforming Mars expansions only to users who registered their copy of Terraforming Mars. You may choose to completely turn off these announcements at any time by going to your profile. If you are not logged in to your account, you may also use the Unsubscribe page and enter the e-mail address that you used for your Account. Please note that if you unsubscribe, you will not receive any e-mails from us at all - even privileged offers. If you change your mind later, you may turn the announcements back on by returning to your profile.

Canceling your Account
To cancel your account, contact us using the Customer Service page. After cancellation, you will not be able to use your Account anymore. Online gaming, services, privileges and other features will no longer be available to you. No refund will be issued for features or services that you have previously paid for.

Your rights
Pursuant to the terms of the Directive 95/46/EC relative to the Protection of the Personal Data, any person can correct, supplement, update, block or erase data affecting him or her when errors, inaccurate information or data, the collection, use, transfer, keeping of which is forbidden, have been detected. If you wish to review, update, correct or delete the Personal Information, you may do so in your Account by contacting us at https://asmodee.helpshift.com or by editing their profile via the Service. If you completely delete all of your Personal Information, then your Account may become deactivated. We will use our best efforts to honor your request within 30 days following your receipt. We may retain an archived copy of your records as required by law. Otherwise Personal information is not retained any longer than necessary for the utilization of the Services/Site or their processing. You can stop all collection of information by the Application(s) by uninstalling the Application(s). You may use the standard uninstall processes as may be available as part of your mobile device or via the mobile application marketplace or network. The automated processing of personal data carried out using the Site/Services is subject to a declaration to the CNIL, the French Data Protection Authority, under the number 1986774.

Third Party Websites
Our Site may contain links to third party websites. When you click on a link to any other website or location, you will leave our Site and go to another site and another entity may collect Personal Information or anonymous data from you. We have no control over, do not review, and cannot be responsible for, these outside websites or their content. Please be aware that the terms of this Privacy Policy do not apply to these outside websites or content, or to any collection of your Personal Information after you click on links to such outside websites. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of every website you visit. The links to third party websites or locations are for your convenience and do not signify our endorsement of such third parties or their products, content or websites.

Security of Your Personal Information
We are committed to protecting the security of your personal information. We and/or our third party partners use a variety of industry-standard security technologies and procedures to attempt to safeguard and protect your personal information collected through the Site/Services from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. However, please remember that no method of transmission over the Internet or any wireless network, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, while we strive to protect your Personal Information, we cannot ensure or warrant the security of any information that you transmit to us or from us, and you do so at your own risk. We cannot ensure or warrant the security of any information you transmit to us by email and you do so at your own risk. When we use third parties to assist us in processing your Personal Information or credit card information we take reasonable steps to require that they comply with this Privacy Policy and otherwise protect your Personal Information (including any credit card information). If there is a breach of security involving your credit card information from our Site/Services, we will inform you immediately and take commercially reasonable steps to rectify such breach. If you believe your Personal Information is being improperly used by us or any third party, please immediately notify us via email at https://asmodee.helpshift.com We also require you to enter a password to access your Account information. Please do not disclose your Account password to unauthorized people.
Changes to this Privacy Policy
This Privacy Policy may be updated from time to time for any reason. We will notify you of any material changes to our Privacy Policy by posting the new Privacy Policy here at https://asmodee.helpshift.com and we will change the "Last Revised" date above. You should consult this Privacy Policy regularly for any changes.
Privacy Policy Questions
If you have any general questions about our Privacy Policy, please contact us at : https://asmodee.helpshift.com

18. HEALTH OF VIDEO GAME USERS

ASMODEE DIGITAL advises you to take the following precautions in all cases when using a Service. Avoid playing if you are tired and/or short of sleep. Make sure that you play in a well lit room and moderate the brightness of your screen. When you play a video game or use a Service requiring connection to a screen, play at a good distance from the screen and as far away as the connection lead allows. During use, take breaks of ten (10) to fifteen (15) minutes every hour.
Epilepsy Warning
Some individuals are liable to have epileptic fits including, in certain cases, loss of consciousness, particularly when exposed to strong luminous stimulations: rapid succession of images or repetition of simple geometrical figures, flashes, or explosions. Such individuals are exposed to risks of fits when they play certain video games containing such luminous stimulations, even if they have no pre-existing medical conditions or have never themselves been prone to epileptic fits. If you or a member of your family have previously presented symptoms of epilepsy (fit or loss of consciousness) in the presence of luminous stimulations, consult your doctor before any use. Parents must also pay particularly close attention to their children when they play video games. If you or your child present one of the following symptoms: dizziness, vision problems, contraction of the eyes or muscles, disorientation, involuntary movement or convulsions, or momentary loss of consciousness, you must immediately stop playing and consult a doctor.

English: As the Helion Corportation, you can use Heat to reduce the MC cost of the South Pole melting.
Japanese: ヘリオン・コーポレーションとして、ヒートを使って南極が溶けるときのMCコストを下げることができます。

English:
In Terraforming Mars, you control a corporation, and you buy and play cards describing different projects. The projects often directly or indirectly contribute to the terraforming process, but can also consist of business enterprises of different kinds. In order to win, you have to accumulate a good <color=#ffab49>terraform rating (TR)</color> and many <color=#ffab49>victory points (VPs)</color>. Your TR is increased each time you raise a global parameter (<color=#ffab49>temperature, oxygen or ocean</color>). Your TR determines your basic income, as well as your basic score. As the terraforming process proceeds, more projects become feasible. Additional VPs are awarded for anything enhancing mankind’s grip on the solar system. This can be anything, from founding cities to building infrastructure, or protecting the environment.

Time is measured in generations, and each generation starts with a Turn Order phase, followed by a Research phase, in which players access new cards. In the Action phase, players take turns doing 1 or 2 actions, going around the table until everyone has passed. Then, in the Production phase, all players produce resources according to their production parameters on the player boards, and gain income from their TR.
 
 The central game view has tracks for temperature, oxygen level, terraform rating, and generations. There is a surface map where you add ocean tiles, greenery tiles, and city tiles as the game progresses. There is also a list of standard projects available to all players, as well as milestones and awards that players can compete for.
 
 The game ends when there is enough oxygen to breathe (14%), oceans enough to allow Earth-like weather (9), and the temperature is well above freezing (+8°C). It will then be possible, if not comfortable, to live on the surface of Mars!
 
 <color=#ffab49>The winner is the player with most VPs at the end of the game. VPs come from your TR, your tiles on the game view, won awards, claimed milestones, and VPs on cards you have played.</color>
Japanese:
テラフォーミング・マーズでは、あなたは企業をコントロールし、さまざまなプロジェクトについて書かれたカードを購入しプレイします。プロジェクトは、直接または間接的にテラフォーミングプロセスに貢献することが多いですが、さまざまな種類の事業で構成されていることもあります。勝つためには、良い<color=#ffab49>テラフォーム評価(TR)</color>と多くの<color=#ffab49>勝利ポイント(VP)</color>を蓄積する必要があります。TRはグローバルパラメータ（<color=#ffab49>温度、酸素、海洋</color>）を上げるたびに上昇します。TRはあなたの基本収入と、基本スコアを決定します。テラフォーミングが進むにつれて、より多くのプロジェクトが実現可能になります。人類の太陽系支配を強化するものには、追加のVPが与えられます。これは、都市の設立、インフラの構築、環境の保護など、何でもありです。

各世代はターンオーダーフェイズで始まり、次にリサーチフェイズで新しいカードにアクセスします。アクションフェイズでは、プレイヤーは1つか2つのアクションを順番に行い、全員がパスするまでテーブルを回ります。そして、生産フェイズでは、すべてのプレイヤーが、プレイヤーボードに書かれた生産パラメータに従って資源を生産し、そのTRから収入を得ます。

 中央のゲームビューには、温度、酸素濃度、テラフォーム評価、世代などのトラックがあります。地表マップには、海洋タイル、緑地タイル、都市タイルがあり、ゲームの進行に応じて追加していきます。また、全プレイヤーが参加できる標準的なプロジェクトのリストや、プレイヤーが競い合うマイルストーンやアワードも用意されています。

 ゲームは、呼吸に十分な酸素があり（14％）、地球のような天候を可能にするほどの海洋があり（9）、気温が氷点下（＋8℃）を大きく超えた時点で終了します。そうなれば、快適とは言えないまでも、火星の地表で生活することは可能になります！

<color=#ffab49>ゲーム終了時に最も多くのVPを持っているプレイヤーが勝者となります。VPは、あなたのTR、ゲームビュー上のあなたのタイル、獲得したアワード、主張したマイルストーン、あなたがプレイしたカードのVPから得られます</color>。
ゲーム概要

English:
Temperature, oxygen, and ocean are called <color=#ffab49>global parameters</color>. Whenever you raise one of them, your terraform rating also increases by that much, giving you a higher income and score. 
 When a global parameter has reached its goal, it can’t be raised any further, and so does not increase your TR. You may still play cards and actions that increase the parameter - just ignore that part of the effect. 
 When all three global parameters have reached their goal, the game ends after that generation (after the production phase).
Japanese:
温度、酸素、海洋は<color=#ffab49>グローバルパラメータ</color>と呼ばれます。これらのパラメータを上げるたびに、テラフォーム評価もその分上がり、収入やスコアが高くなります。
 グローバルパラメータが目標値に達すると、それ以上上げることができなくなるので、TRが増えることはありません。ただし、そのパラメータを上昇させるカードやアクションをプレイすることはできますので、その部分の効果は無視してください。3 つのグローバルパラメータがすべて目標値に達した場合、その世代（生産フェイズの後）をもってゲームは終了します。
グローバルパラメータ

English: 1. Player Tags: Where you see each player’s TR and corporation, and the player order. Allows you to skip or pass a turn.
Japanese: 1.プレイヤータグ。各プレイヤーのTRと企業、プレイヤーの順番が表示される場所。ターンのスキップやパスができるようになる。

English: 2. Current generation: The generation you are at.
Japanese: 2.現在の世代。あなたが今いる世代。

English: 3. Oxygen: This global parameter starts at 0% and ends at 14%.
Japanese: 3.酸素。0%から始まり14%で終了するグローバルなパラメータ。

English: 4. Temperature: This global parameter starts at -30°C and ends at 8°C, and goes up 2°C each step.
Japanese: 4.温度。このグローバルパラメーターは-30℃から始まり、8℃で終わり、2℃ずつ上がっていく。

English: 5. Oceans: The amount of Ocean placed on Mars. You can place up to 9.
Japanese: 5.オーシャン火星に配置された海洋の量です。最大9個まで配置できます。

English: 6. Bonus steps: If you raise the parameter to this point, you also get the attached bonus.
Japanese: 6.ボーナスステップ。ここまでパラメータを上げると、付属のボーナスも得られます。

English: 7. Standard Projects: Allows you to do standards projects. May be used by any player regardless of what cards you have.
Japanese: 7.標準プロジェクト。スタンダードプロジェクトを行うことができるようになります。持っているカードに関係なく、どのプレイヤーも使用することができます。

English: 8. Milestones: Allows you to claim Milestones for extra VPs at the end of the game.
Japanese: 8.マイルストーンマイルストーンを獲得すると、ゲーム終了時に追加でVPを獲得できます。

English: 9. Awards: Allows you to fund Awards for extra VPs at the end of the game.
Japanese: 9.アワードゲーム終了時にVPを追加するためのアワードの資金を調達することができるようになります。

English: 10. Placement bonuses: When placing a tile on an area with a placement bonus, you get the listed resources or cards.
Japanese: 10.プレイスメントボーナス配置ボーナスのあるエリアにタイルを置くと、記載されている資源やカードが手に入ります。

English: 11. Ocean-reserved areas: Blue areas are reserved for ocean tiles; ocean tiles may only be placed here and no other tile may be placed here.
Japanese: 11.海洋の予約エリア青い部分は海洋タイル専用で、ここにしか海洋タイルは置けず、他のタイルは置けません。

English: 12. Special reserved areas: 3 areas are reserved for specific cities. No other tiles may be placed there.
Japanese: 12.特別予約地域。3つのエリアは特定の都市のために予約されています。他のタイルはそこに置くことができません。

English: 13. Player Board: The information on the resources and resource productions you have during the game.
Japanese: 13.プレイヤーボード。ゲーム中に所持している資源や資源生産物の情報です。

English: 14. Card hand: Where you can see and use your cards.
Japanese: 14.カードの手元。カードを見たり使ったりする場所。

English: 15. Card Resources: All cards that can accumulate resources, and the resources placed on them.
Japanese: 15.カードの資源資源を蓄積できる全てのカードと、その上に配置された資源。

English: 16. Tags: All of the tags you’ve accumulated from all the cards you’ve played, except for red cards. Can be used for requirements and for certains cards.
Japanese: 16.タグ赤のカードを除く、すべてのカードで貯めたタグのこと。条件や、あるカードに使用することができる。

English: 17. VPs: All VPs you’ve accumulated so far in the game, excluding dynamic VPs.
Japanese: 17.VPsゲーム内でこれまでに貯めたVPのうち、ダイナミックVPを除くすべてのVPです。

English: 18. Actions: A list of all the Actions that can be used by you.
Japanese: 18.Actions（アクション）。あなたが使用できるすべてのActionのリストです。

English: 19. Effects: A list of all of the effects you’ve accumulated during the game.
Japanese: 19.効果ゲーム中に蓄積された効果の一覧です。

English: 20. Corporation: You can see your corporation and its bonus anytime through this button.
Japanese: 20.企業です。このボタンからいつでも企業とそのボーナスを確認することができます。
ゲームビュー

English:
The game view has a map where tiles may be placed. When placing a tile, you must first check to see if there are any placement restrictions. There are areas reserved for ocean and specific cities, where no other tiles may be placed. Furthermore, each tile may have specific restrictions on the respective card or in the summaries below.
 
 When you place the tile, you receive the <color=#ffab49>placement bonus</color> on that area (if any). You also get a bonus for placing tiles next to ocean tiles (see below).
Japanese:
ゲームビューには、タイルを配置することができるマップがあります。タイルを配置する際には、まず配置制限があるかどうかを確認する必要があります。海洋や特定の都市には、他のタイルを置くことができない領域があります。さらに、各タイルには、それぞれのカードや以下のまとめにあるような具体的な制約がある場合があります。

 タイルを配置すると、その領域で<color=#ffab49>配置ボーナス</color>を受け取ります（ある場合）。また、海洋タイルの隣にタイルを置くとボーナスが得られます(下記参照)。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Ocean tile: Ocean tiles may only be placed on areas reserved for ocean (see map).</color> Placing an ocean tile increases your TR by 1 step. Ocean tiles are not owned by any player. Each ocean tile on the board provides a 2 M€ placement bonus for any player later placing a tile, even another ocean, next to it. 
 Example: If you place a city tile adjacent to 2 different ocean tiles you get 4 M€ as placement bonus.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>海洋タイル。海洋タイル：海洋タイルは海洋用に確保された場所(マップ参照)にのみ置くことができる。</color> 海洋タイルを置くと、自分のTRが1段階上昇する。海洋タイルはどのプレイヤーにも所有されていない。ボード上の各海洋タイルは、後でタイルを置くプレイヤーに2M€の配置ボーナスを提供し、その隣に他の海洋であっても置くことができます。 
例：2つの海洋タイルに隣接して都市タイルを配置した場合、配置ボーナスとして4M€を得ます。

English: <color=#ffab49>Greenery tile: If possible, greenery tiles must be placed next to another tile that you own.</color> If you have no available area next to your tiles, or if you have no tile at all, you may place the greenery tile on any available area. <color=#ffab49>When placing a greenery tile, you increase the oxygen level, if possible, and also your TR. If you can’t raise the oxygen level you don’t get the increase in TR either.</color> Greenery tiles are worth 1 VP at the end of the game, and also provide 1 VP to any adjacent city (see below).
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>緑地タイル：可能であれば、緑地タイルはあなたが所有している他のタイルの隣に置かなければなりません。</color>あなたのタイルの隣に空いている場所がない場合、または全くタイルがない場合、緑地タイルは空いている場所に置くことができます。 <color=#ffab49> 緑地タイルを置くとき、可能ならあなたは酸素レベルを上げ、また、あなたのTRも上げます。</color>緑地タイルはゲーム終了時に1VPの価値があり、また隣接する都市（下記参照）にも1VPを提供します。

English: <color=#ffab49>City tile: May not be placed next to another city</color> (exception: Noctis City must always be placed on its reserved area). Each city tile is worth 1 VP for each adjacent greenery tile (regardless of owner) at the end of the game. (Note: the card Capital places the unique <color=#ffab49>Capital</color> city tile, which counts and scores like a normal city tile, but additionally gives you VPs for adjacent ocean tiles, as stated on the card.)
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>都市タイル：他の都市の隣に置くことはできません</color>（例外：Noctis Cityは常にその予約区域に置かなければなりません）。各都市タイルは、ゲーム終了時に隣接する緑地タイル（所有者に関係なく）1枚につき1VPの価値があります。(注：カード「首都」は、独特の<color=#ffab49>Capital</color>都市タイルを配置します。これは通常の都市タイルと同様にカウントし得点しますが、カードに記載されているように、さらに隣接する海洋タイルのVPを与えます)。

English: <color=#ffab49>Special tiles:</color> Some cards allow you to place special tiles. Any function or placement restriction is described on the card.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>特殊タイル:</color> カードによっては特殊タイルを配置することができます。機能や配置の制限については、カードに記載されています。
タイル

English: The player board keeps track of your current resources and production. <color=#ffab49>The numbers inside brown boxes refer to production</color> of that resource, while the number below refer to the amount of resource (see image below).
Japanese: プレイヤーボードには、現在の資源と生産量が記録されています。 <color=#ffab49>茶色のボックス内の数字はその資源の生産量</color>を、下の数字は資源の量を表しています（下図参照）。

English: 1. <color=#ffab49>Production tracks:</color> When you gain production of a resource, the number increases. During the production phase, you gain resources equal to your production.
Japanese: 1.<color=#ffab49>生産トラック：</colo>資源を生産すると、数値が増加します。生産フェイズ中、生産量に等しい資源を獲得する。

English: 2. <color=#ffab49>MegaCredits (M€):</color> Are used to pay for cards and other things. <color=#ffab49>Note: Your M€ income is the sum of your M€ production and your TR.</color> M€ production is the only production that can be negative, but it may never be lowered below -5.
Japanese: 2.<color=#ffab49>メガクレジット(M€):</color> カードなどの支払いに使用します。 <color=#ffab49>注意: M€収入はM€生産とTRの合計です。</color> M€生産だけがマイナス生産ですが、決して-5以下に下げることができません。

English: 3. <color=#ffab49>Steel:</color> Is only used to pay for cards with a building tag and is worth 2 M€/resource. You may pay with both M€ and steel, but you get no refund for ’overpaying’ with steel.
Japanese: 3.<color=#ffab49>鋼鉄:</color> 建築タグの付いたカードの支払いにのみ使用され、1資源あたり2M€の価値があります。M€と鋼鉄の両方で支払うことができますが、鋼鉄で「払いすぎた」場合の返金はありません。

English: 4. <color=#ffab49>Titanium:</color> Is only used to pay for cards with a space tag and is worth 3 M€/resource, similar to steel.
Japanese: 4.<color=#ffab49>チタン：</color> 宇宙タグを持つカードの支払いにのみ使用され、鋼鉄と同様に3M€/資源の価値があります。

English: 5. <color=#ffab49>Plants:</color> May be converted into greenery tiles by using the depicted action.
Japanese: 5.<color=#ffab49>植物:</color>描かれたアクションを使用することで、緑地タイルに変換することができる。

English: 6. <color=#ffab49>Energy:</color> Is used by many cards. <color=#ffab49>All leftover energy is converted into heat at the beginning of the production phase.</color>
Japanese: 6.<color=#ffab49>エネルギー：</color> 多くのカードで使用されています。 余ったエネルギーは、生産段階の最初に熱に変換されます。

English: 7. <color=#ffab49>Heat:</color> May be spent to raise temperature by 1 step by using the depicted action.
Japanese: 7.<color=#ffab49>熱:</color> 描かれたアクションを使うことで、気温を1段階上げるために消費することができる。
プレイヤーボード

English:
Each player starts the game with a <color=#ffab49>corporation card</color>. During the game, players buy and play many <color=#ffab49>project cards</color> to get benefits of different kinds. Project
cards are divided into active cards (blue), automated cards (green)
and event cards (red). See below to learn how they are played.
Japanese: 各プレイヤーは<color=#ffab49>企業カード</color>を持ってゲームを開始します。ゲーム中、プレイヤーは多くの<color=#ffab49>プロジェクトカード</color>を購入してプレイし、さまざまな種類の利益を得ます。プロジェクトカードには、アクティブカード（青）、オートメーションカード（緑）、イベントカード（赤）があり、それぞれどのように遊ぶかは、以下をご覧ください。
<color=#ffab49>企業カード</color>

English: 1. <color=#ffab49>Tag:</color> Places the card in certain categories, which can affect or be affected by other cards, or by the player board (e.g. you can pay with steel when playing a building tag).
Japanese: 1.<color=#ffab49>タグ:</color> そのカードを特定のカテゴリに配置し、他のカードやプレイヤーボードに影響を与えたり与えたりします（例：建物のタグを出すときに鉄で支払うことができます）。

English: 2. <color=#ffab49>Starting conditions:</color> This tells you how much money (M€) you start with, as well as other starting resources and production. Some corporations also have a fixed first action described here (see example card).
Japanese: 2.<color=#ffab49>開始条件:</color> これはあなたがどれだけのお金（M€）で開始するか、また他の開始資源や生産量を示しています。また、企業によってはここに記述されている最初の行動が決まっているものもあります（カード例参照）。

English: 3. <color=#ffab49>Effect / Action:</color> Boxes marked by a blue ribbon show an ongoing effect or action that may be used during the game. Actions may be used only once per generation, while effects are always active.
Japanese: 3.<color=#ffab49>効果/行動:</color> 青いリボンでマークされたボックスは、ゲーム中に使用することができる進行中の効果または行動を示しています。アクションは1世代に1回しか使用できませんが、エフェクトは常に有効です。

English: 4. <color=#ffab49>Flavor text:</color> Gives you some background information and feeling for the card.
Japanese: 4.<color=#ffab49>フレーバーテキスト：</color> カードの背景情報とフィーリングを与えます。
<color=#ffab49>プロジェクトカード</color>

English: 5. <color=#ffab49>Cost:</color> This is what you pay to play the card from your hand. (To get cards into your hand, you must first buy them during the research phase).
Japanese: 5.<color=#ffab49>コスト:</color> 手札からカードをプレイするために支払う金額です。(カードを手札に入れるには、まず研究フェイズにカードを購入する必要があります)。

English: 6. <color=#ffab49>Requirement:</color> Any requirement must be met in order to play the card. Some cards require a global parameter to have reached a certain level, while others can only be played while the parameter is still low (see example card). Some cards require that you have certain tags or production. (Note: In order to play the card you must also be able to perform the effects of the card.) Note also that the requirement only needs to be fulfilled when playing the card, not when you use it later.
Japanese: 6.<color=#ffab49>条件：</color> カードをプレイするためには、何らかの条件を満たす必要があります。グローバルパラメータが一定以上に達していることを条件とするカードもあれば、パラメータが低いうちしかプレイできないカードもあります（カード例参照）。また、特定のタグやプロダクションを持っていることを条件とするカードもあります。(注：カードをプレイするためには、そのカードの効果を実行できることも必要です)。また、条件を満たす必要があるのは、そのカードをプレイするときだけで、後で使うときには必要ないことに注意してください。

English: 7. <color=#ffab49>Immediate effects:</color> Most cards affect your (or your opponent’s) resources or production. You may also get tiles to place, or other effects.
Japanese: 7.<color=#ffab49>即時効果:</color> ほとんどのカードはあなた（または対戦相手）の資源や生産に影響を及ぼします。また、配置するタイルや、その他の効果を得ることもあります。

English: 8. <color=#ffab49>VPs:</color> Some cards give you victory points at the end of the game.
Japanese: 8.<color=#ffab49>VP:</color>カードによっては、ゲーム終了時に勝利ポイントを得られるものもあります。

English: <color=#ffab49>If you are uncertain of how a card works, read the text at the bottom of the card.</color>
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>カードの仕組みがわからない場合は、カードの下にあるテキストを読んでください。
カード

English: <color=#ffab49>Players:</color> In standard game, you start with 1 extra production of each resource. Each player also starts with a TR of 20.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>プレイヤー:</color> 標準ゲームでは、各資源の生産量が1ずつ増えている状態でスタートします。また、各プレイヤーはTRが20の状態でスタートします。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Choose cards:</color> A Beginner Corporation gets to keep all their 10 cards for free, while the other players now simultaneously choose which corporation to play, and what project cards to keep in their starting hand.
Each card costs 3 M€, and the remaining cards are discarded.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>カードの選択:</color> ビギナーコーポレーションは10枚のカードを全て無料でキープすることができ、他のプレイヤーは同時にどの企業をプレイするか、またどのプロジェクトカードをスタート時の手札にキープするかを選択します。
カードは1枚3M€で、残りのカードは捨て札になります。

English: <color=#ffab49>Start the game:</color> The first generation starts without a player order phase and without a research phase (since you just performed those phases during setup), so the first player just starts the action phase.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>ゲーム開始:</color> 第1世代はプレイヤーオーダー・フェイズも研究フェイズもなく（セットアップ時にそれらのフェイズを実行したばかりなので）、最初のプレイヤーは行動フェイズを開始するだけです。
セットアップ

English: Because of the long time spans needed for the projects, this game is played in a series of generations. Each generation the players go through 4 phases.
Japanese: このゲームは、プロジェクトに長い時間が必要なため、何世代にもわたってプレイされます。各世代でプレイヤーは4つのフェーズを経験する。

English:
<color=#ffab49>1) Player Order phase</color>
The first player moves to the bottom of the player menu on the left side of the screen, while all other players move up. The generation number increases. 
This phase is skipped the first generation (see setup).
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>1) プレイヤーオーダーフェイズ</color>
最初のプレイヤーは画面左のプレイヤーメニューの一番下に移動し、他のプレイヤーは上に移動します。世代数が増えていきます。このフェーズは第1世代ではスキップされます（セットアップを参照）。

English:
<color=#ffab49>2) Research phase</color>
Each player is offered 4 cards and decides which of them they want to buy to their hand. Each card costs 3 M€ to buy to the hand, and you may buy 0-4 cards. The rest of the 4 drawn cards are discarded. 
<color=#ffab49>There is no hand limit.</color> If the deck runs out of cards, the discarded cards are reshuffled. This phase is also skipped the first generation (see setup).
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>2) リサーチフェイズ</color>
各プレイヤーは4枚のカードを提示され、その中から手札に購入するものを決めます。
手札にするためには、1枚につき3M€が必要で、0〜4枚を購入することができます。
<color=#ffab49>手札の制限はありません。</color>山札が無くなったら、捨て札をシャッフルします。この段階は第一世代でもスキップされる(セットアップを参照)。

English:
<color=#ffab49>3) Action phase</color>
Players take 1 or 2 actions each turn, or pass. Play proceeds in the same order as the player tags until all players have passed. The actions may be combined in any way the player chooses. The available actions are:
A) Play a card from your hand.
B) Use a standard project.
C) Claim a milestone.
D) Fund an award.
E) Use the action on a blue card.
F) Convert 8 plants into a greenery tile (which gives an oxygen increase).
G) Convert 8 heat into a temperature increase.
<color=#ffab49>You can choose to take 1 or 2 actions on your turn. If you take no action at all (pass), you are out of the round and may not take any more actions this generation, but as long as you take actions, you will get more turns. When everyone has passed, the action phase ends.</color>

Inventrix and Tharsis Republic have a pre-defined first action, meaning that the first of your two allowed actions on your first turn is used for this purpose. You may use the second action for that turn normally, if you want.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>3) アクションフェイズ</color>
プレイヤーは毎ターン1～2アクションを行うか、パスします。
プレイヤーの札と同じ順番で、すべてのプレイヤーがパスするまでプレイが進行します。アクションはプレイヤーが自由に組み合わせることができます。使用できるアクションは、
A) 手札からカードを1枚プレイする。
B) 標準プロジェクトを使用する。
C) マイルストーンを主張する。
D) アワードに資金を提供する。
E) 青カードのアクションを使用する。
F) 8つの植物を緑地タイルに変換する（これは酸素の増加を与える）。
G) 8つの熱を温度上昇に変換する。
<color=#ffab49>自分のターンでは、1つか2つのアクションを選択することができます。全く行動を起こさない（パス）場合、そのラウンドから外れ、この世代ではもう行動を起こすことはできませんが、行動を起こす限り、ターンは増えます。全員がパスしたら、アクション・フェイズは終了します</color>。

インベントリクスとサーシス共和国にはあらかじめ最初の行動が定められており、最初のターンに許された2つの行動のうち1つ目がこの目的のために使われることを意味します。そのターンの2回目のアクションは、望むなら普通に使ってもかまいません。

English:
<color=#ffab49>4) Production phase</color>
First, all energy resource is converted into heat resource. Secondly, all players receive new resources:
Players get M€ according to their terraform rating plus any M€ production (which may be negative!), then the players also get any other resources they have production of according to the player board.
Finally, used action cards become available again.

Now you are ready to start the next generation.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>4) 生産フェイズ</color>
まず、すべてのエネルギー資源が熱資源に変換されます。次に、すべてのプレイヤーが新しい資源を受け取ります。
プレイヤーは自分のテラフォームのレーティングに応じたM€と、M€の生産量（マイナスになることもあります！）を受け取り、さらにプレイヤーボードに従って生産している他の資源も受け取ります。
最後に、使用済みのアクションカードが再び使用可能になります。

これで、次の世代を始める準備が整いました。
世代

English:
<color=#ffab49>A) Play a card from your hand</color>
When playing a card, there are 2 steps to consider:
1) Check the requirements.
2) Pay for the card and get any immediate effects.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>A) 手札からカードをプレイする</color>
カードをプレイする場合、2つのステップを考慮する必要があります。
1) カードの要件を確認する。
2) カードの代金を支払い、即座に効果を得る。

English:
<color=#ffab49>1) Check the requirements.</color>
In order to play a card you must meet its <color=#ffab49>requirements</color> and be able to perform the <color=#ffab49>effects</color> stated on the card, with the following exceptions: You may play a card that...
- raises global parameters that have already reached their goal (for example when there are no more ocean tiles, or when the temperature is at +8 °C).
- adds resources that you can’t collect (for example adding microbe resources without having any microbe project to place them on).
-removes resources for any player (red-bordered resource icons, see example on card C below) if you can’t or do not wish to. Even if these effects can’t be performed, you may still play the card, performing all other effects as usual.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>1) 要件の確認</color>
カードをプレイするには、そのカードの<color=#ffab49>要件</color>を満たし、カードに書かれている<color=#ffab49>効果</color>を実行できる必要がありますが、次の例外があります。
ただし、以下の場合は例外とします…
- 既に目標値に達しているグローバルパラメータを上げる（例：海洋のタイルが無くなった時、気温が+8℃になった時など）。
- 収集できない資源を追加する（例えば、配置する微生物プロジェクトがないのに、微生物資源を追加する）。
- 資源を回収できない、または回収したくない場合、任意のプレイヤーの資源（赤枠の資源アイコン、下記カードCの例参照）を回収します。これらの効果を実行できない場合でも、このカードをプレイし、他の効果 を通常通り実行することができます。

English:
Cards <color=#ffab49>A</color>, <color=#ffab49>B</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color> and <color=#ffab49>E</color> below each have a requirement listed next to the card’s cost. To play card <color=#ffab49>A</color>, you need to have titanium production. To play card <color=#ffab49>B</color>, the oxygen level needs to be 9% or lower, and you also need to have energy production since the card requires you to decrease your energy production. To play card <color=#ffab49>D</color>, the oxygen level must be 9% or higher. You also need to have plant production, since the card requires you to decrease your plant production. Card <color=#ffab49>E</color> requires 5% oxygen and energy production.
The cost required to play the card is stated in the upper left corner. Some blue cards already in play may give you a discount (for example, <color=#ffab49>E</color> gives a discount when playing a space card). You may also use steel and titanium to help pay for building and space cards respectively.
Japanese:
以下のカード<color=#ffab49>A</color>、<color=#ffab49>B</color>、<color=#ffab49>D<color>、<color=#ffab49>E<color>にはそれぞれカードのコストの横に必要条件が記載されています。カード<color=#ffab49>A</color>をプレイするには、チタンの生産が必要です。カード<color=#ffab49>B</color>をプレイするには、酸素濃度が9%以下である必要があり、またエネルギー生産量を減少させる必要があるため、エネルギー生産量も必要です。カード<color=#ffab49>D</color>をプレイするには、酸素濃度が9%以上であることが必要です。また、このカードは植物の生産を減少させる必要があるため、植物の生産が必要です。カード<color=#ffab49>E</color>は酸素とエネルギーの生産が5%必要です。
カードをプレイするために必要なコストは、左上に記載されています。すでにプレイされている青いカードは、割引を受けることができます（例えば、<color=#ffab49>E</color>は宇宙カードをプレイするときに割引を受けます）。また、「鋼」と「チタン」は、それぞれ建物カードと宇宙カードの支払いに充てることができます。

English:
<color=#ffab49>2) Paying and performing immediate effects.</color>
First you must pay the card’s cost.
Then the lower panel of the card shows you any immediate effects. These effects (and other effects triggered by the card you just played) are performed.
Any <color=#ffab49>production</color> (see brown boxes on cards <color=#ffab49>A</color>, <color=#ffab49>B</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color> & <color=#ffab49>E</color>) must be performed. Resources or production with a red frame means that you can affect any player you choose (even yourself). Resources or production without red frames always affect yourself and must be performed. So card <color=#ffab49>A</color> essentially steals a titanium production from an opponent, while in <color=#ffab49>B</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color> and <color=#ffab49>E</color> you must decrease your own energy or plant production in order to increase your M€ production.
Cards may also feature tiles and tags with a red border, and that red border signifies that you may target any player’s tiles or tags. This is also specified in the card text.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>2) 即効性のある効果の支払いと実行 </color>
まず、このカードのコストを支払います。
次に、カードの下のパネルに、あらゆる即時効果が表示されます。これらの効果（および今プレイしたカードによって誘発される他の効果）を実行します。
あらゆる<color=#ffab49>生産</color>（カード<color=#ffab49>A</color>, <color=#ffab49>B</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color> & <color=#ffab49>E</color> の茶色枠参照）を実行しなければなりませ ん。赤枠のある資源やプロダクションは、選んだプレイヤーに（自分自身にも）影響を与えることができることを意味します。赤枠のない資源や生産は、常に自分自身に影響を与え、実行されなければなりません。つまり、<color=#ffab49>A</color>は基本的に相手からチタンの生産を奪いますが、<color=#ffab49>B</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color>, <color=#ffab49>E</color> では自分のM€生産を増やすために自分のエネルギーまたは植物生産を減少しなければなりません。
また、カードには赤枠のタイルやタグが描かれていることがありますが、この赤枠は、どのプレイヤーのタイルやタグも対象にしてよいということを意味しています。これはカードのテキストにも明記されています。

English:
Any resources (<color=#ffab49>C</color>) are gained, or removed. Again, a red border means you can choose the resources of any one player, so playing card <color=#ffab49>C</color> is usually not very nice. Red-bordered resources are optional, though, so card <color=#ffab49>C</color> does not force you to remove your own plants, even if you are the only player that has any plant resources. Non-standard resources (that are not collected on your player board) are instead collected on specific cards (<color=#ffab49>D</color>). By default, those resources are usually placed on the same card that generates them.
Livestock (<color=#ffab49>D</color>), for example, gains 1 animal resource on it when you use its action (a blue card’s action may be used only once per generation).
Any tiles (<color=#ffab49>B</color>) placed by the card follow the rules for tiles. 
<color=#ffab49>If a card symbol has an asterisk (*), then it is an exception to the normal rules, and you must read the explanation in parenthesis to see details of how the card works.</color>
VP icons (see cards <color=#ffab49>A</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color>, <color=#ffab49>E</color>) serve no function during play, but will be counted in the final scoring. Card <color=#ffab49>D</color> may be worth several VPs if its action (top panel) has had time to work a few times to add more animal resources to the card.

<color=#ffab49>Events</color> (red cards, <color=#ffab49>C</color>). Their tags only apply while being played (for example using the discount on card <color=#ffab49>E</color> when playing a space event).

<color=#ffab49>Active cards</color> (blue, <color=#ffab49>D</color>, <color=#ffab49>E</color>) have ongoing effects that may trigger at any time, or actions that you may use (just like the corporations).
Japanese:
任意の資源(<color=#ffab49>C</color>)を獲得、または除去することができます。繰り返しになりますが、赤枠は任意のプレイヤーの資源を選択できることを意味しますので、カード<color=#ffab49>C</color>をプレイすることは通常あまりいいことではありません。しかし、赤枠の資源は任意なので、カード<color=#ffab49>C</color>は、たとえ自分だけが植物資源を持っていたとしても、自分の植物を強制的に除去することはありません。標準的でない資源（自分のプレイヤーボードに集められないもの）は、代わりに特定のカード（<color=#ffab49>D</color>）に集められます。デフォルトでは、これらの資源は通常、それを生成したカードと同じカードに置かれます。
例えば、家畜(<color=#ffab49>D</color>)は、そのアクションを使用すると動物資源を1つ獲得します（青カードのアクションは1世代に1回のみ使用可能です）。
カードによって配置されるタイル(<color=#ffab49>B</color>)はタイルのルールに従います。
<color=#ffab49>カードのシンボルにアスタリスク(*)がある場合、それは通常のルールの例外であり、そのカードの作用の詳細については括弧内の説明を読む必要があります。</color>
VPアイコン（カード<color=#ffab49>A</color>, <color=#ffab49>D</color>, <color=#ffab49>E</color> を参照）はプレイ中は機能しませんが、最後の得点にカウントされます。カード<color=#ffab49>D</color>は、そのアクション（上段）が数回働いて、より多くの動物資源をカードに追加する時間があれば、数VPの価値がある場合があります。

<color=#ffab49>イベント</color>（赤いカード、<color=#ffab49>C<color>）。そのタグはプレイしている間のみ適用されます（例えば宇宙イベントをプレイしている時にカード<color=#ffab49>E</color>の割引を使うなど）。

<color=#ffab49>アクティブカード</color>（青、<color=#ffab49>D</color>、<color=#ffab49>E</color>）はいつでも発動できる進行中の効果や、（企業と同様に）使用できるアクションを持っています。

English:
<color=#ffab49>B) Use a standard project</color>
 The 6 standard projects are always available to the players. Each of them may be used several times during the same generation.
 1) <color=#ffab49>Sell patents:</color> You may discard 1 or more cards from hand to gain 1 M€ per card discarded.
2) <color=#ffab49>Power plant:</color> For 11 M€ you get to increase your energy production 1 by step.
 3) <color=#ffab49>Asteroid:</color> For 14 M€ you get to increase temperature by 1 step (and therefore your TR).
4) <color=#ffab49>Aquifer:</color> For 18 M€ you get to place an ocean tile (you also get 1 TR and collect any placement bonus for the tile).
5) <color=#ffab49>Greenery:</color> For 23 M€ you get to place a greenery tile, which increases oxygen level (and your TR) by 1 step, and collect any placement bonus for the tile.
 6) <color=#ffab49>City:</color> For 25 M€ you get to place a city tile (collect any placement bonus for the tile). You also get to increase your M€ production by 1 step.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>B) 標準プロジェクトを使う</color>
6つの標準プロジェクトは、プレーヤーが常に利用できるようになっています。
それぞれ、同じ世代で何度か使用することができます。
1) <color=#ffab49>パテントを売る:</color>手札を1枚以上捨て、1枚捨てるごとに1M€を得ることができます。
2) <color=#ffab49>発電所:</color> 11M€でエネルギー生産量を1段階増やすことができるようになります。
3) <color=#ffab49>小惑星:</color> 14M€で気温を1段階上昇させることができます（したがって、あなたのTRも上昇します）。
4) <color=#ffab49>Aquifer:</color> 18M€で海洋タイルを配置できます（1TRとタイルの配置ボーナスも得られます）。
5) <color=#ffab49>緑地化:</color>23M€で酸素を1段階増やす緑地タイルが置けます。
6) <color=#ffab49>都市化:</color> 25M€で都市タイルを置くことができます（タイルの配置ボーナスはすべて回収します）。また、M€の生産量を1段階増加させることができます。

English:
<color=#ffab49>C) Claim a milestone</color>
If you meet the criteria of a milestone, you may claim it by paying 8 M€. A milestone may only be claimed by one player, and only 3 of the 5 milestones may be claimed in total, so there is a race for these! Each claimed milestone is worth 5 VPs at the end of the game.

These are the <color=#ffab49>milestones</color> and what you need to claim them (besides paying 8 M€):
1) <color=#ffab49>Terraformer:</color> Having a terraform rating of at least 35.
2) <color=#ffab49>Mayor:</color> Owning at least 3 city tiles.
3) <color=#ffab49>Gardener:</color> Owning at least 3 greenery tiles.
4) <color=#ffab49>Builder:</color> Having at least 8 building tags in play.
5) <color=#ffab49>Planner:</color> Having at least 16 cards in your hand when you claim this milestone.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>C)マイルストーンの獲得</color> マイルストーンの条件を満たしている場合、8M€を支払うことで獲得できます。マイルストーンは1人しか獲得できず、5つのマイルストーンのうち3つまでしか獲得できないので、獲得競争となります。マイルストーンを獲得すると、ゲーム終了時に5VPの価値が与えられます。

これらが<color=#ffab49>マイルストーン</color>とその取得のための条件 (8M€ の支払いに加えて必要)です:
1) <color=#ffab49>Terraformer:</color> 35以上のテラフォーム評価を持っていること
2) <color=#ffab49>Mayor:</color> 都市タイルを3つ以上持っていること
3) <color=#ffab49>Gardener:</color> 緑のタイルを3枚以上所有している。
4) <color=#ffab49>建築家:</color> 建造物タグを8枚以上所持している。
5) <color=#ffab49>Planner:</color>このマイルストーンを達成した時、手札が16枚以上あること。

English:
<color=#ffab49>D) Fund an award</color>
There is no requirement that must be met to fund an award. The first player to fund an award pays 8 M€. The next player to fund an award pays 14 M€, the last pays 20 M€. Only three awards may be funded. Each award can only be funded once. 
In the final scoring, each award is checked, and 5 VPs are awarded to the player who wins that category - it does not matter who funded the award! The second place gets 2 VPs (except in a 2-player game where second place does not give any VPs). Ties are friendly: more than one player may get the first or second place bonus. If more than one player gets 1st place bonus, no 2nd place is awarded.

These are the <color=#ffab49>awards</color> and what they are awarded for:
1) <color=#ffab49>Landlord:</color> Owning the most tiles in play.
2) <color=#ffab49>Banker:</color> Having the highest M€ production.
3) <color=#ffab49>Scientist:</color> Having the most science tags in play.
4) <color=#ffab49>Thermalist:</color> Having the most heat resource.
5) <color=#ffab49>Miner:</color> Having the most steel and titanium resource.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>D) アワードに出資する</color>
アワードに出資するために満たさなければならない要件はありません。
最初にアワードに出資するプレイヤーは8M€を支払います。次に資金を提供するプレイヤーは14M€、最後に提供するプレイヤーは20M€を支払います。資金を提供できるのは3つのアワードのみです。各アワードには一度だけ資金を提供することができます。
最終的なスコアリングでは、各アワードがチェックされ、そのカテゴリーで優勝したプレイヤーに5VPが与えられます - 誰がそのアワードに資金を提供したかは関係ありません!2位には2VPが与えられます(ただし、2人用ゲームでは2位にはVPが与えられません)。同点は友好的です：複数のプレイヤーが1位または2位のボーナスを得ることができます。もし、複数のプレイヤーが1位のボーナスを獲得した場合、2位は与えられません。

これらが<color=#ffab49>アワード</color>とそのアワードの条件です:
1) <color=#ffab49>Landlord:</color> プレイ中の最も多くのタイルを所有していること。
2) <color=#ffab49>Banker:</color> 最も多くのM€を生産していること。
3) <color=#ffab49>科学者:</color>プレイ中の科学タグを最も多く持っている。
4) <color=#ffab49>Thermalist:</color>最も多くの熱資源を持っている。
5) <color=#ffab49>Miner:</color>鋼鉄とチタンの資源を最も多く持っている。

English:
<color=#ffab49>E) Use the action on a blue card</color>
Many blue cards and corporations have actions, as indicated by a red arrow. <color=#ffab49>Each such action card may be used once each generation.</color> When you use an action on a blue card, you must first pay any cost stated to the left of the arrow. You get whatever the arrow points to.

Blue cards may also have effects that are always active, like Shuttles (Card E): When you play a space card, it costs 2 M€ less. These effects are not actions (no red arrow), so you can always use them.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>E) 青カードのアクションを使用する</color>
多くの青カードや企業には、赤い矢印で示されたアクションがあります。 <color=#ffab49> そのようなアクションカードは各世代に1回使用できます。</color> 青カードのアクションを使う場合、あなたはまず矢印の左側に書かれているコストを支払う必要があります。あなたは矢印が指し示すものを何でも得ることができます。

青カードは、《シャトル》（カードE）のように、常に有効な効果を持つこともあります。シャトル（カードE）：宇宙カードをプレイするとき、そのコストが2M€少なくなります。これらの効果はアクションではないので（赤い矢印はありません）、常に使用することができます。

English:
<color=#ffab49>F) Convert plants into greenery</color>
 8 plant resources may be turned into a greenery tile, which increases oxygen level by 1 step (and therefore also your TR by 1 step).
 Note that the greenery tile must be placed next to another of your tiles (if possible) and may generate placement bonuses.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>F) 植物を緑に変換する</color>
8つの植物資源を緑地タイルに変換することができ、酸素レベルを1段階（したがってあなたのTRも1段階）増加させることができます。
なお、緑地タイルは自分のタイルの隣に置かなければならず（可能であれば）、配置ボーナスが発生する場合があります。

English:
<color=#ffab49>G) Convert heat into temperature</color>
 8 heat resources may be spent to increase temperature by 1 step (and therefore also your TR by 1 step).
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>G) 熱を温度に変換する</color>
熱資源8個を消費して、温度を1段階上げることができます（したがって、あなたのTRも1段階上がります）。
アクション

English: When all three global parameters (ocean, temperature, and oxygen) have reached their goals, the game ends at the end of that generation. After the production phase, <color=#ffab49>players have one extra chance to convert plants into one or more greenery tiles</color> (in player order; this may also trigger other effects such as placement bonuses). Then the final scoring takes place.
Japanese: 3つのグローバルパラメータ（海洋、気温、酸素）がすべて目標に達したとき、その世代の終了時にゲームは終了する。生産フェイズの後、<color=#ffab49>プレイヤーは植物を1つ以上の緑地タイルに変換する追加チャンスが1回あります(プレイヤー順。これは配置ボーナスなど他の効果を誘発することもあります)。その後、最終的な採点が行われます。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Final scoring</color>
1) <color=#ffab49>TR:</color> Your TR at the end of the game is your basic score. You add VPs to it from the rest of the scoring.
2) <color=#ffab49>Awards:</color> Gives the leading player in that category 5 VPs and the runner-up 2 VPs (except in a 2-player game). Ties are friendly: Players at the same level get the same VPs for 1st or 2nd place. If more than one player gets 1st place bonus, no 2nd place is awarded.
3) <color=#ffab49>Milestones:</color> Each claimed Milestone is worth 5 VPs.
4) <color=#ffab49>Game View:</color> Players get VPs from the map on the game view. Each greenery tile is worth 1 VP and each city tile is worth 1 VP for each greenery adjacent to it (regardless of who owns the greenery tiles). Other tiles are worth VPs based on what’s written on the card that allowed the player to place them.
5) <color=#ffab49>Cards:</color> First add all VPs on cards that collect resources. Then gather all of your remaining played cards (including all your played events!) and add your VPs. If you have Jovian cards, these may have to be added separately. 

The player with the highest total score is the winner! Any ties are won by having the most M€.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>Final scoring</color>
1) <color=#ffab49>TR:</color> ゲーム終了時のあなたのTRはあなたの基本スコアとなります。これに残りの得点からVPを加算します。
2) <color=#ffab49>Awards:</color> そのカテゴリのトッププレイヤーに5VP、次点プレイヤーに2VPを与えます（2人プレイの場合は除く）。同点は友好的である。同レベルのプレイヤーは、1位または2位に対して同じVPを獲得します。複数のプレイヤーが1位のボーナスを獲得した場合、2位は与えられません。
3) <color=#ffab49>マイルストーン:</color> マイルストーンは1つにつき5VPの価値があります。
4) <color=#ffab49>ゲーム画面:</color> プレイヤーはゲーム画面上のマップからVPを獲得します。各緑のタイルは1VPの価値があり、各都市のタイルはそれに隣接する緑ごとに1VPの価値があります（緑のタイルを誰が所有しているかは関係ありません）。その他のタイルは、プレイヤーが配置することを許可したカードに書かれている内容に基づいて、VPの価値があります。
5) <color=#ffab49>カード:</color> まず、資源を集めるカードに書かれているVPを全て足します。次に、残りのプレイしたカード（プレイしたイベントも含む！）をすべて集め、VPを加算します。木星人カードがある場合は、別途追加する必要があります。
合計得点が最も高いプレイヤーが勝者となります。同点の場合は、M€の多い方が勝ちとなります。
ゲーム終了

English:
<color=#ffab49>Corporate Era (extended game):</color>
Corporate Era adds cards marked with a red and white icon to the deck, as well as 2 new corporations.
Players start with no extra production of resources (see Setup).
Corporate Era focuses on economy and technology. These are projects that do not contribute directly to the terraforming, but make the corporations stronger, adding new strategic choices to the game.
Playing Corporate Era makes the game longer and more complex. We do not recommend it for players new to Terraforming Mars.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>Corporate Era (extended game):</color>
Corporate Eraは赤と白のアイコンが付いたカードをデッキに追加し、新しい企業も2つ追加します。
プレイヤーは資源の追加生産がない状態でスタートします（セットアップを参照）。
企業時代」は経済と技術に重点を置いています。これらはテラフォーミングに直接貢献しないプロジェクトですが、企業をより強くし、ゲームに新たな戦略的選択肢を加えます。
コーポレートエラをプレイすると、ゲームはより長く、より複雑になります。テラフォーミング・マーズを初めてプレイされる方にはお勧めできません。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Solo version:</color>
The solo version always uses the Corporate Era setup; include all the Corporate Era cards and start without any production, except for what your corporation may give you. All rules apply as usual with these exceptions:
<color=#ffab49>1)</color> 2 neutral city tiles are placed on the map with an adjacent greenery tile each (these tiles are not yours, and do not increase the oxygen level.)
Special case: If you choose to play Tharsis Republic this game, you get M€ production for the 2 neutral cities even though they are placed before you reveal your corporation.
<color=#ffab49>2)</color> When playing solo, you don’t use the Beginner Corporations.
<color=#ffab49>3)</color> Start with a terraform rating of 14 instead of 20 and without the extra production of resources described for the standard game.
<color=#ffab49>4)</color> Awards and Milestones are not used.
<color=#ffab49>5)</color> You have a neutral opponent that you can steal from, or reduce any kind of resources and production from.
<color=#ffab49>6)</color> You always play 14 generations (marked ’solo’). In order to win, you need to complete terraforming (i.e making the three global parameters reach their goal) before the end of generation 14. After generation 14, you may convert plants into greenery tiles, following normal rules but without raising the oxygen, and finally you score VPs to get as high a score as possible. If you have not completed terraforming by the end of generation 14, you lose.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>ソロバージョン:</color>
ソロバージョンは常に企業時代の設定を使用します。すべての企業時代のカードを含み、あなたの企業があなたに与えるものを除いて、何の生産もせずに開始します。すべてのルールは通常通り適用されますが、以下の例外があります:
<color=#ffab49>1)</color>中立都市タイル2枚が、それぞれ隣接する緑地タイルとともにマップに配置されます(これらのタイルはあなたのものではなく、酸素レベルを増加させることはありません。)特殊ケースです。このゲームでサーシス共和国を選択した場合、企業を公開する前に中立都市2枚が配置されていても、M€の生産量を得ます。
<color=#ffab49>2)</color> ソロプレイの場合、ビギナーコーポレーションを使用しません。
<color=#ffab49>3)</color> テラフォーム評価は20ではなく14から始まり、標準ゲームで説明されている資源の追加生産はありません。
<color=#ffab49>4)</color> アワードとマイルストーンは使用しません。
<color=#ffab49>5)</color> あなたは中立の相手から盗んだり、どんな資源や生産も減らせたりすることが可能です。
<color=#ffab49>6)</color> あなたは常に14世代をプレイします（「ソロ」と表示されます）。勝つためには、第14世代が終わるまでにテラフォーミングを完了させる（つまり、3つのグローバルパラメータを目標値に到達させる）必要があります。第14世代以降は、通常のルールに従って、植物を緑地タイルに変換することができますが、酸素を上げることはできず、最後にVPを獲得して、できるだけ高いスコアを得ることになります。第14世代終了までにテラフォーミングが完了していなければ負けです。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Draft variant:</color>
 If more interaction is desired, the Draft variant may be used. During the Research phase the players draft 4 cards to buy from instead of just drawing 4 to buy from:
 Each player first gets 4 cards and chooses one to draft, putting it aside and passing the rest to the next player. Then you have 3 cards; set aside 1 of them and pass the rest to the left. Then set aside 1 of the 2 you receive, pass the last card, and finally receive your last card.
 Then examine the 4 cards you’ve set aside (drafted) and choose which to buy (3 M€ each) and which to discard.
 Drafting is not used during the first generation since the first Research phase is skipped (see Setup). Cards are passed clockwise during even-numbered generations and counter-clockwise during odd-numbered generations.
 This variant allows players to affect which cards other players get access to, and increases your ability to pursue a certain strategy, or predict which parameter will rise first.
 The Draft Variant adds some extra game time and is not recommended for players new to Terraforming Mars.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>ドラフトバリアント:</color>
より多くの相互作用が必要な場合、Draft variantを使用することができます。調査フェイズの間、プレイヤーは4枚のカードから買うためにただ引くのではなく、以下の形でドラフトします：
各プレイヤーはまず4枚のカードを手に入れ、ドラフトするカードを1枚選び、それを脇に置き、残りを次のプレイヤーに渡します。
次に、自分のカードが3枚あるので、そのうちの1枚を脇に置き、残りを左側に渡します。
次に受け取った2枚のうち1枚を脇に置き、最後の1枚をパスし、最後に自分のカードを受け取ります。
そして、脇に置いた4枚のカード（ドラフト）を吟味し、どれを買い（各3M€）、どれを捨てるかを選びます。
第1世代では、最初の研究フェイズがスキップされるため、ドラフトは使用されません（セットアップを参照）。カードは、偶数世代では時計回りに、奇数世代では反時計回りに渡されます。
この変種は、他のプレイヤーがどのカードにアクセスできるかに影響を与えることができ、特定の戦略を追求したり、どのパラメータが先に上昇するかを予測したりする能力を高めることができます。
ドラフト変種はゲーム時間を延長するものであり、「Terraforming Mars」を初めてプレイする方にはお勧めできません。
ゲームバリアント

English:
<color=#ffab49>Victory Points</color>
 You win the game by having the most Victory Points (VPs). VPs are scored at the end of the game for your Terraform rating, from tiles on the map, from Milestones and Awards, and from many of the cards.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>勝利ポイント(VP)</color>
あなたは、最も多くの勝利ポイント(VP)を持っていればゲームに勝 ちます。
VPはゲーム終了時にテラフォーム評価、マップ上のタイル、マイルスト ーンやアワード、そして多くのカードから得られます。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Parameters</color>
Terraforming Mars is about making Mars earthlike enough to live freely on it. There are 4 parameters on the game scene connected to this process: Terraform rating, temperature, oxygen level and ocean coverage.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>パラメーター</color>
テラフォーミング・マーズは、火星を自由に住めるような地球型にすることです。
ゲームシーンには、このプロセスに関連する4つのパラメータがあります。テラフォーム評価、温度、酸素濃度、海洋面積です。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Terraform Rating (TR)</color> is the measure of how much you have contributed to the terraforming process. <color=#ffab49>Each time you raise the oxygen level, the temperature, or place an ocean tile, your TR increases as well.</color>
Each step of TR is worth 1 VP at the end of the game, and the
Terraforming Committee awards you income according to
your TR. You start at 20.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>テラフォーム評価（TR）</color>は、あなたがテラフォーミングにどれだけ貢献したかを示す指標です。 <color=#ffab49>酸素レベルや温度を上げたり、海洋タイルを配置するたびに、TRも増加します。</color>
TRは1段階ごとにゲーム終了時に1VP分の価値があり、テラフォーミング委員会からはあなたのTRに応じて収入が与えられます。20からスタートします。

English: The mean <color=#ffab49>temperature</color> at the equator is raised 2°C at a time from -30°C to +8°C. This will create an equatorial zone where water stays liquid. This symbol means that you raise the temperature by 1 step, and therefore you also increase your TR 1 by step.
Japanese: 赤道の平均<color=#ffab49>気温</color>を-30℃から+8℃まで一度に2℃ずつ上げていく。そうすると、水が液体のまま保たれる赤道付近ができる。この記号は、温度を1段階上げるということなので、TRも1段階上げるということです。

English: The <color=#ffab49>oxygen</color> level is measured as a percentage of an atm of pressure, meaning that this percentage is comparable to Earth’s 21% oxygen. At 14% the atmosphere resembles that of Earth at a 3000 m elevation. This symbol means that you raise the oxygen level by 1 step, and therefore also increase your TR by 1 step.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>酸素濃度</color>は、1気圧に対する割合で測定され、この割合は地球の21％の酸素と同等であることを意味します。14％では、標高3000mの地球の大気に似ている。この記号は、酸素濃度を1段階上げると、TRも1段階上がるという意味です。

English:
Each <color=#ffab49>ocean tile</color> represents 1% ocean coverage.
 With 9% of the surface covered by oceans, Mars will have a hydrological cycle, creating rain and rivers. This symbol means that you place an ocean tile, and therefore also increase your TR by 1 step (and get any placement bonus).
Japanese:
各<color=#ffab49>ocean tile</color>は1%の海洋被覆率を表します。
表面の9％が海洋に覆われた火星では、水循環が行われ、雨や川が作られるでしょう。このシンボルは海洋タイルを配置することを意味し、したがってあなたのTRも1ステップ増加します（そして配置ボーナスも得られます）。

English:
<color=#ffab49>Resources</color>
The six standard resources are megacredits, steel, titanium, plants, energy and heat, and they are all collected on the player board. Certain cards may also collect other resources (usually animal and microbe cards). If a card adds a non-standard resource, it is generally placed on that same card. If a card adds a resource to another card, then that card has to be a card that collects that kind of resource.
Japanese:
<color=#ffab49>資源</color>
標準的な資源は、メガクレジット、鉄、チタン、植物、エネルギー、熱の6つで、これらはすべてプレイヤーボードに集められます。また、特定のカードは他の資源を集めることがあります（通常は動物や微生物のカード）。カードが標準的でない資源を追加する場合、一般にその同じカードに配置されます。あるカードが他のカードに資源を追加する場合、そのカードはその種類の資源を集めるカードでなければなりません。

English: The <color=#ffab49>MegaCredit (M€)</color> is the general currency used for buying and playing cards and using standard projects, milestones, and awards.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>MegaCredit (M€)</color> は、カードの購入やプレイ、標準プロジェクト、マイルストーン、アワードの使用に使用される一般的な通貨です。

English: <color=#ffab49>Steel</color> represents building material on Mars. Usually this means some kind of magnesium alloy. Steel is used to pay for building cards, being worth 2 M€ per steel.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>鉄</color>は火星の建材を表しています。通常はマグネシウム合金のようなものを指します。鋼鉄は建物カードの支払いに使われ、1鋼鉄あたり2M€の価値があります。

English: <color=#ffab49>Titanium</color> represents resources in space or for the space industry. Titanium is used to pay for space cards, being worth 3 M€ per titanium.
Japanese: <color=#ffab49>チタン</color>は、宇宙空間や宇宙産業の資源を表します。チタンは宇宙カードの支払いに使用され、1個あたり3M€の価値があります。
